newsitem.title: USA: GM invests $300 mln in Mich. stamping plant.
newsitem.headline: GM invests $300 mln in Mich. stamping plant.

text.p: General Motors Corp said it will invest about $300 million at the Flint Metal Center for new manufacturing equipment and tooling to prepare the plant for future product programs.

GM also said it will update existing presses at the metal stamping plant, which is a part of its Metal Fabricating Division. The Flint facility produces engine cradles and major and minor sheet metal panels for GM cars, trucks, and mid-size vans.
The automaker in 1994 initiated an aggressive program to simplify its stamping operations and use common manufacturing equipment and processes throughout its 13 North American stamping plants.
GM said its investments in the Flint Metal Center will help accelerate its plan to identify common processes or best practices that can be shared with other facilities.
"This commitment to update the Flint Metal Center supports our continuing efforts to commonize GM's stamping operations," plant manager Donald Mayton said in a statement.
Mayton said the new equipment will enhance the facility's ability to respond quickly to changes in product mix or customer preference demands.
The plant employs 3,996 people, or nearly 12 percent of the Metal Fabricating Division's 34,000-member workforce.
